title: Quezon farmer held for illegal possession of ‘threatened’ birds
author: Delfin T. Mallari Jr.
content: /nINQUIRER FILE PHOTO/n/nLUCENA CITY — A farmer is facing charges for illegally possessing three threatened birds in Real town in Quezon province./nThree threatened white-eared brown dove (Phapitreron leucotis), locally known as “kulo-kulo,” were confiscated from farmer Michael on Monday, according to a report from the Quezon police on Tuesday, Aug. 27./nREAD: Illegal wildlife trader nabbed in Quezon/nAuthorities and Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) operatives, raided at 2:28 p.m. the residence of Michael, 37, in Barangay Tagumpay and found the three birds, without permits from the DENR./nThe white-eared brown dove is listed under the Updated List of Threatened Philippine Flora and Fauna under Department Administrative Order 2019-09./nPossession of these birds without proper government authorization makes a person liable for violations of Republic Act 9147 or the Wildlife Resources Protection and Conservation Act./nThe suspect has been detained as criminal charges were being readied./nThe birds are in the custody of the local DENR office and will soon be released back into the wild./nSubscribe to our daily newsletter/nBy providing an email address.
